general.name: Estimate visual acuity (near and/or far, each eye separately- can use chart in Maxwell’s)
Inspect external ocular structures (lids, cornea, conjunctiva).
Evaluate extra ocular muscle function to cover 6 cardinal directions  - part of neuro exam
Check for convergence – part of neuro exam
Test visual fields by confrontation - part of neuro exam
Symmetric Corneal Light Reflection: Light source 2 ft. in front of pt's eyes.
Observe pupillary response to light (direct) – part of Cranial Nerve exam
Observe pupillary response to light (consensual) – part of Cranial Nerve exam
Inspect anterior structures using tangential lighting.

ear.name: Inspect auricles and posterior auricular regions bilaterally
WEBER Test (512 Hz tuning fork) – fork in middle of head
RINNE Test (512 Hz tuning fork) – fork behind ear

Nose/Sinuses.name: Test for patency of both nasal passages
Inspect nasal vaults with nasal speculum on otoscope

Mouth.name: Inspect floor of mouth  & base of tongue
Observe elevation of the palate by asking patient to say "Ah" – part of neuro exam

Neck.name: Palpate thyroid with and without  swallowing (isthmus and lobes)
